attributes.action: ask the Chancellor to reverse the tax changes in the 2007 Budget which mean that part-time workers  and those on low incomes are paying for tax relief for the well-off.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The tax changes in the 2007 Budget mean that a greater tax burden falls on part-time workers without children like myself, on the low paid (£12,00-£18,000 a year)trainee nurses and on under 25s. Those earning £42,000 a year are unaffected by the changes while people like myself are worse off. This government supposedly represents the interests of working people, and yet it discriminates against the lowest paid.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
